Typealiases.html#/s:044RVS_BTDriver_Watc.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Device_InterfaceController_DisplayStringTuple
Typealiases.html#/s:044RVS_BTDriver_Watc.abstract: This is a simple key/value tuple type that we use for our display.

Typealiases.html#/s:044RVS_BTDriver_Watc.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Main_InterfaceController_DeviceContext
Typealiases.html#/s:044RVS_BTDriver_Watc.abstract: This typealias allows us to pass the main context, as well as the device instance, to the device listing sheet.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:0.name: isEmpty
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:0.abstract: Returns true, if yes, we have no bananas.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:0.name: count
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:0.abstract: The number of elements we have. 1-based. 0 is no elements (isEmpty is true).

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.name: RVS_SequenceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.abstract: If you conform to this protocol, you get a few basic Sequence attributes for free.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.name: firstUppercased
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.abstract: This extension lets us uppercase only the first letter of the string (used for weekdays).

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.name: urlEncodedString
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.abstract: The following computed property comes from this: http://stackoverflow.com/a/27736118/879365

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.name: index(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.abstract: This allows us to find the first index of a substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.name: endIndex(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.abstract: This allows us to find the last index of a substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.name: indexes(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.abstract: This returns an Array of indexes that map all the occurrences of a given substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.name: ranges(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy044R.abstract: This returns an Array of Index Ranges that map all the occurrences of a given substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html.name: StringProtocol
Extensions/StringProtocol.html.abstract: These are a variety of cool String extensions that add some great extra cheese on the pizza.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: prefs
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: These are the shared persistent prefs for the test harness app.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: useDifferentThreadSwitch
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is a switch that reflects and controls whether or not the driver will be set up to use a non-main thread. True means that it uses the Global Thread.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: rescanSwitch
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is a switch that reflects and controls whether the scan will “discover” the device, even if it has been removed. If false, then removing a device -even while scanning- will cause it to remain removed until scanning is toggled again.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: persistentConnectionSwitch
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is a switch that reflects and controls whether or not the initial connection (to get device info) is retained, so the device remains in connected state. If true, then the connection will remain on. If false, the connection is terminated just after reading the info.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: useDifferentThreadSwitchHit(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is called when the Use Different Thread switch is toggled.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: rescanSwitchHit(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is called when the Rescan switch is toggled.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: persistentConnectionSwitchHit(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is called when the Persistent Connection switch is toggled.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: awake(withContext:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when the sheet is loaded.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: rowIDString
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The string used to instantiate our table rows.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: settingsSegueID
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The ID for our settings push. Used to reset the driver.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: wasScanning
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is a simple semaphore, to re-enable scanning.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: settingsCalled
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is a simple semaphore, to indicate that the settings screen was called.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: driverInstance
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is our instance of the actual BLE driver.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: prefs
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: These are the shared persistent prefs for the test harness app.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: noBTDisplay
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The group that contains the “No Bluetooth” image.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deviceDisplayTable
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The table that displays the list of discovered devices.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: scanningButton
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The switch that controls whether or not the app is scanning for devices.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: settingsButton
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The “gear” settings button. Touching this, brings in the settings screen.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: scanningButtonHit(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when the “Scanning” switch is pressed.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: setUpDriver()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This establishes the driver instance, wiping out any old one.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: setUpUI()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Make sure the correct items are shown or hidden.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: populateTable()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This adds devices to the table for display.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deleteDevice(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is called by the details screen, to delete a device from the list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: displayAlert(header:message:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Displays the given message and title in an alert with an “OK” button.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: awake(withContext:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when the instance is being initialized for use.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: willActivate()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called just before we are displayed.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: contextForSegue(withIdentifier:in:rowIndex:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Table touch handler.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: contextForSegue(withIdentifier:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is called when we are about to bring in another sheet.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: btDriver(_:encounteredThisError:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Simple error reporting method.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: btDriver(_:newDeviceAdded:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when a new device is discovered while scanning.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: btDriverStatusUpdate(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver’s status should be checked.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: displayLabel
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The only item is a device name label.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: delegateObject
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Shortcut to fetch the delegate instance, cast correctly. May be nil.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deleteSegueID
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The ID of the delete segue

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: prefs
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: These are the shared persistent prefs for the test harness app.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deviceInstance
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is a reference to the device from the driver.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deviceData
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is an Array of key/value tuples, representing the data to be displayed.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: owner
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This refers to our presenting controller. We use this to kick the delete command back up the chain.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: iOffedMyself
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: A semaphore, indicating that this device was deleted, so we will dismiss as soon as we come into play.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: displayTable
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The table, displaying the values.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deletButton
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The Delete Button, shown at the bottom of the screen.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deleteMyself()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called by the delete screen, to delete this device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: populateTable()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called to set up the table of values.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: awake(withContext:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when the sheet is loaded.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: willActivate()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called just before the screen is shown.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: didDeactivate()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called just after the screen disappears.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: contextForSegue(withIdentifier:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is called just as a segue to the delete screen is called.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: rowID
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The row ID for this class.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: keyLabel
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The label for the value key.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: valueLabel
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The label for the value.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: owner
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is the presenting view controller.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: deletePromptLabel
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The lable for the “DELETE?” question.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: yesButton
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The “YES” button.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: noButton
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: The “NO” button.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: yesButtonHit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when the “YES” button is hit.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: noButtonHit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when the “NO” button is hit.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: awake(withContext:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: Called when the instance is being initialized for use.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.name: useDifferentThread
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.abstract: This is the key for the “Use A Different Thread” pref.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.name: continuousScan
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.abstract: This is the key for the “Keep Scanning and Include Duplicates” pref.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.name: persistentConnections
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.abstract: This is the key for “persistent connections.” The device remains connected, once discovered.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..name: keys
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..abstract: An Array of String, containing the keys used to store and retrieve the values from persistent storage.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: incorrectKeys(invalidElements:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Some elements were presented that do not fit our keys. The associated value is an Array of the failing keys.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: valuesNotPlistCompatible(invalidElements:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Not all of the elements in the _values Dictionary are Plist-Compatible. The associated value is an Array of the failing keys.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: noStoredPrefsForKey(key:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: We were not able to find a stored pref for the given key. The associated value is the key we are looking for.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: unknownError(error:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Unknown thrown error. The associated value is the error (if any).

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: _values
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This is the Dictionary. It’s private, and shouldn’t need to be accessed outside this base class.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: _save()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This is a private method that saves the current contents of the _values Dictionary to persistent storage, keyed by the value of the “key” property.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: _load()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This is a private method that reads in the data from persistent storage for this instance (using the “key” property), and loads the _values Dictionary property.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: PrefsError
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Errors that Can be thrown from methods in this class

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: key
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This is the key that is used to store and fetch the collection of data to be used to populate the _values Dictionary.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: lastError
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This is any error that was thrown during a save or a load.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: keys
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This computed property MUST be overridden by subclasses.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.name: values
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.abstract: This is an accessor for the _values Dictionary. Before it returns the Dictionary, it loads data from persistent storage.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This is a direct-access subscript that allows you to use the prefs object to reach its stored properties.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.name: init()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.abstract: The default initializer uses the current subclass typename as the main key.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: init(key:values:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: You can initialize instances with a key and some initial data values.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.name: clear()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:044R.abstract: This clears the values, and deletes the pref from the UserDefaults.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html.name: RVS_PersistentPrefs
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html.abstract: This class is designed to act as an “abstract” base class, providing a simple Dictionary datastore that is stored in the UserDefaults in the Application Bundle. It is designed to be reliable, and extremely simple to use.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..name: RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..abstract: This class extends the prefs class to provide persistent prefs storage. This is used across all test harnesses.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Device_InterfaceController_DeleteConfirmController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This handles the “Delete” confirmation screen.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Device_InterfaceController_TableRowController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This class defines one row of the table that displays the values.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Device_InterfaceController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This displays the information for one device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_ExtensionDelegate
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is the main extension delegate class for the Watch standalone app.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Main_InterfaceController_TableRowController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This describes one row of the table that displays devices.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Main_InterfaceController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This is the interface controller for the main screen (the one that lists devices).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.name: RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harness_Settings_InterfaceController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_WatchOS_Test_Harnes.abstract: This class controls the display of the settings screen.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
